2L1.1.title: Smuggling, Transporting, or Harboring an Unlawful Alien

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Was the defendant convicted under 8 U.S.C. § 1327 of a violation involving an alien who was inadmissible under 8 U.S.C. § 1182(a)(3)?

yesResult.description: Conviction under 8 U.S.C. § 1327 involving inadmissible alien under § 1182(a)(3)

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Was the defendant convicted under 8 U.S.C. § 1327 of a violation involving an alien who previously was deported after a conviction for an aggravated felony?

yesResult.description: Conviction under 8 U.S.C. § 1327 involving alien previously deported after aggravated felony conviction

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Was the offense committed other than for profit, OR did it involve smuggling, transporting, or harboring only the defendant's spouse or child (or both)?
specificOffenseCharacteristics.condition: Only applies if the base offense level is determined under subsection (a)(3)

yesEffect.description: Non-profit or family-only offense with base level from (a)(3)

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: How many unlawful aliens were smuggled, transported, or harbored?
How many prior felony immigration and naturalization convictions does the defendant have?
specificOffenseCharacteristics.condition: Must have been sustained before committing any part of the instant offense

options.label: Two or more convictions from separate prosecutions

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve smuggling, transporting, or harboring an unaccompanied minor?
specificOffenseCharacteristics.condition: Minor was unaccompanied by parent, adult relative, or legal guardian

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: What was the level of weapon involvement? (Apply the greatest)

options.label: Dangerous weapon brandished or otherwise used

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve intentionally or recklessly creating a substantial risk of death or serious bodily injury?

yesEffect.description: Created substantial risk of death or serious bodily injury

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: What was the most serious death or injury that occurred?
Which of the following applies? (Apply the greater)

options.label: Alien involuntarily detained through coercion/threat or for payment after smuggling or while transported/harbored
Harboring conviction for prostitution with aggravating role (adult)
options.condition: Defendant convicted of alien harboring for prostitution and receives §3B1.1 adjustment

options.label: Harboring conviction for prostitution with aggravating role (minor under 18)
options.condition: Defendant convicted of alien harboring for prostitution and receives §3B1.1 adjustment, victim under 18

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Was the defendant convicted under 8 U.S.C. § 1324(a)(4)?

2L1.2.title: Unlawfully Entering or Remaining in the United States

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Before the defendant was ordered deported or removed from the United States for the first time, did the defendant have a conviction for a felony offense (other than an illegal reentry offense) for which the sentence imposed was five years or more?

yesResult.description: Base level 8 + 10 level increase for pre-deportation felony with 5+ year sentence

baseOffenseQuestions.text: After the defendant was ordered deported or removed from the United States for the first time, did the defendant have a conviction for a felony offense (other than an illegal reentry offense) for which the sentence imposed was five years or more?

yesResult.description: Base level 8 + 10 level increase for post-deportation felony with 5+ year sentence

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Before the defendant was ordered deported or removed from the United States for the first time, did the defendant have a conviction for a felony offense (other than an illegal reentry offense) for which the sentence imposed was two years or more?

yesResult.description: Base level 8 + 8 level increase for pre-deportation felony with 2+ year sentence

baseOffenseQuestions.text: After the defendant was ordered deported or removed from the United States for the first time, did the defendant have a conviction for a felony offense (other than an illegal reentry offense) for which the sentence imposed was two years or more?

yesResult.description: Base level 8 + 8 level increase for post-deportation felony with 2+ year sentence

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Before the defendant was ordered deported or removed from the United States for the first time, did the defendant have a conviction for a felony offense (other than an illegal reentry offense) for which the sentence imposed exceeded one year and one month?

yesResult.description: Base level 8 + 6 level increase for pre-deportation felony with 1+ year and 1 month sentence

baseOffenseQuestions.text: After the defendant was ordered deported or removed from the United States for the first time, did the defendant have a conviction for a felony offense (other than an illegal reentry offense) for which the sentence imposed exceeded one year and one month?

yesResult.description: Base level 8 + 6 level increase for post-deportation felony with 1+ year and 1 month sentence

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Did the defendant commit the instant offense after sustaining a conviction for a felony that is an illegal reentry offense?

yesResult.description: Base level 8 + 4 level increase for prior illegal reentry felony conviction

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Before the defendant was ordered deported or removed from the United States for the first time, did the defendant have a conviction for any other felony offense (other than an illegal reentry offense)?

yesResult.description: Base level 8 + 4 level increase for pre-deportation other felony conviction

baseOffenseQuestions.text: After the defendant was ordered deported or removed from the United States for the first time, did the defendant have a conviction for any other felony offense (other than an illegal reentry offense)?

yesResult.description: Base level 8 + 4 level increase for post-deportation other felony conviction

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Did the defendant commit the instant offense after sustaining two or more convictions for misdemeanors under 8 U.S.C. § 1325(a)?

yesResult.description: Base level 8 + 2 level increase for two or more prior § 1325(a) misdemeanor convictions

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Before the defendant was ordered deported or removed from the United States for the first time, did the defendant have three or more convictions for misdemeanors that are crimes of violence or drug trafficking offenses?

yesResult.description: Base level 8 + 2 level increase for pre-deportation three or more misdemeanor crimes of violence or drug trafficking

baseOffenseQuestions.text: After the defendant was ordered deported or removed from the United States for the first time, did the defendant have three or more convictions for misdemeanors that are crimes of violence or drug trafficking offenses?

yesResult.description: Base level 8 + 2 level increase for post-deportation three or more misdemeanor crimes of violence or drug trafficking

noResult.description: Base offense level with no enhancements

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the defendant commit the instant offense after sustaining prior convictions for illegal reentry or unlawful entry?

options.label: Two or more convictions for misdemeanors under 8 U.S.C. § 1325(a)
One or more convictions for felony illegal reentry offense

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Before the defendant was ordered deported or removed for the first time, what was the most serious criminal conduct?
specificOffenseCharacteristics.condition: Only applies to convictions for offenses committed at age 18 or older (unless classified as adult conviction)

options.label: Three or more convictions for misdemeanor crimes of violence or drug trafficking
Any other felony offense (other than illegal reentry)
Felony offense (other than illegal reentry) with sentence exceeding 1 year 1 month
Felony offense (other than illegal reentry) with sentence of 2 years or more
Felony offense (other than illegal reentry) with sentence of 5 years or more

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: After the defendant was ordered deported or removed for the first time, what was the most serious criminal conduct?
specificOffenseCharacteristics.condition: Only applies to convictions for offenses committed at age 18 or older (unless classified as adult conviction)

options.label: Three or more convictions for misdemeanor crimes of violence or drug trafficking
Any other felony offense (other than illegal reentry)
Felony offense (other than illegal reentry) with sentence exceeding 1 year 1 month
Felony offense (other than illegal reentry) with sentence of 2 years or more
Felony offense (other than illegal reentry) with sentence of 5 years or more

2L2.1.title: Trafficking in a Document Relating to Naturalization, Citizenship, or Legal

yesResult.description: Base offense level for offenses under §2L2.1

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Was the offense committed other than for profit, or did it involve smuggling, transporting, or harboring only the defendant's spouse or child?

yesEffect.description: Offense committed other than for profit or involved only defendant's spouse/child

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: How many documents or passports were involved in the offense?
Did the defendant know, believe, or have reason to believe that a passport or visa was to be used to facilitate the commission of a felony offense (other than immigration law violations)?
How many prior convictions for felony immigration and naturalization offenses does the defendant have?
specificOffenseCharacteristics.condition: Only applies if the defendant committed any part of the instant offense after sustaining the conviction(s)

options.label: Two or more prior felony immigration convictions (from separate prosecutions)

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the defendant fraudulently obtain or use a passport?

options.label: Fraudulently obtained or used a foreign passport
Fraudulently obtained or used a United States passport

2L2.2.title: Fraudulently Acquiring Documents Relating to Naturalization, Citizenship, or

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Does this case involve fraudulently acquiring documents relating to naturalization, citizenship, or legal resident status for own use; false personation or fraudulent marriage by alien to evade immigration law; or fraudulently acquiring or improperly using a United States passport?

yesResult.description: Base offense level for fraudulent immigration document offenses

noResult.description: Guideline does not apply to this offense

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Is the defendant an unlawful alien who has been deported (voluntarily or involuntarily) on one or more occasions prior to the instant offense?
How many prior felony immigration and naturalization offense convictions does the defendant have after the instant offense was committed?

options.label: Two or more convictions (each from separate prosecution)

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the defendant fraudulently obtain or use a passport?

options.label: Fraudulently obtained or used a foreign passport
Fraudulently obtained or used a United States passport

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the defendant commit any part of the instant offense to conceal involvement in human rights offenses?

options.label: No concealment of human rights involvement
To conceal membership/authority in military/paramilitary/police organization involved in serious human rights offense
To conceal participation in incitement to genocide
To conceal participation in other serious human rights offense
